assessmentItem.title: Find the mid-point, length and equation of a line through two points

div.p: A line passes through the points P (, ) and Q (, ).

ol.li: The gradient of the line joining the two points (integer or fraction)
The coordinates of the mid-point of PQ (to 1 decimal place)
The length of PQ (to 1 decimal place)
The equation of the line through P and Q

div.feedbackInline: Well done, that's the correct value for the gradient.
No, you have swapped the numerator and denominator of the fraction which is the value of the gradient. However, this value will be used in marking your input for the equation.
No, the value you entered for the gradient has the wrong sign. However, this value will be used in marking your input for the equation.
Your value for the gradient is incorrect. However, this value will be used in marking your input for the equation.
Your value for the x-coordinate of the mid-point is incorrect.
No, the value you entered for the x-coordinate of the mid-point has the wrong sign.
Well done, that's the correct x-coordinate of the mid-point.
Your value for the y-coordinate of the mid-point is incorrect.
No, the value you entered for the y-coordinate of the mid-point has the wrong sign.
Well done, that's the correct y-coordinate of the mid-point.
Your value for the length of PQ is incorrect.
No, the value you entered for the length of PQ has the wrong sign.
Well done, that's the correct value for the length of PQ.
Well done, that's the correct equation.
Your line passes through the point P.
Your line does not pass through the point P.
Your line passes through the point Q.
Your line does not pass through the point Q.
You have the wrong sign for the gradient.
You used the gradient of a perpendicular line.
You used the correct gradient.
You used your own calculated value for the gradient.
The gradient is incorrect.
Please enter a value in each box, then submit your answer.

feedbackBlock.p: You have had three attempts at answering this question, so here is the solution:
